授業方法:
This course will primarily be conducted face-to-face. For students who choose (or who are required) to take the course remotely (i.e. online), all class materials, tasks, and explanations will be posted in a Google Classroom dedicated to this class. The Google Classroom code is pbkgt7q. The invite link is https://classroom.google.com/c/MzA5Njk4NDkyODE1?cjc=pbkgt7q

Depending on the evolving situation, course format may include the following:
- Individual, pair, and group discussion based on topics that relate to content
- Sharing of information, including weekly homework assignments, on Google Classroom
- Presentation and homework assignments
- All components of the course will be in English
- Being a graduate class, English tasks will expected to be done at an advanced level

第1回:
**The schedule below is an example of what the course might look like; however, the curriculum will depend on the interests, backgrounds, and needs of enrolled students, as determined by the needs analysis completed during the first class**

Week 1: course description, introductions, ice breakers
第2回: Week 2: What is culture and intercultural communication?
第3回: Week 3: A critical comparison of intercultural competence and cultural intelligence (CQ)
第4回: Week 4: What composes a person's identity? A cross-cultural perspective
第5回: Week 5: Mixed ethnicities and heritages - examining contemporary issues in both Japan and Canada
第6回: Week 6: Using different forms of mass-media to identify and discuss prejudice, discrimination, and racism
第7回: Week 7: A critical look at models of cultural dimensions - Hofstede and Trompenaars & Hampden-Turner
第8回: Week 8: Exploring Paris syndrome and comparable cross-cultural experiences
第9回: Week 9: Examining different varieties of English - World Englishes in verbal and nonverbal forms
第10回: Week 10: Perceptions of world regions (e.g. Scandinavia) and differences between regional neighbors
第11回: Week 11: Adapting to new environments and how Japan is influenced by contemporary culture
トピック.授業外学習2: Around 2 hours of homework can be expected weekly which can involve readings, video clips and written responses. You should have a stable wifi or internet connection at home to complete all out-of-class assignments. A weekly journal of approximately 350 words is expected.
